author: Shubhomoy Sikdar
text:
The Delhi Police on Friday arrested Aam Aadmi Party MLA Mahinder Yadav for allegedly rioting, damaging public property and stopping public servants from performing their duty.

The Vikaspuri MLA was arrested while protesting on the main Nihal Vihar-Najafgarh Road against the alleged rape of a three-year-old girl.

He is the sixth AAP MLA to be arrested in the past 11 months after the AAP came to power. Earlier, Akhilesh Tripathi, Somnath Bharti, Surinder Singh, Manoj Kumar and former Law Minister Jitender Singh Tomar were arrested in different cases.

Mr. Yadav’s arrest has once again put the Delhi Police and the AAP government at loggerheads.

“(Prime Minister) Narendra Modi’s police arrested our MLA instead of arresting the rapist. For them, safety and security of women aren’t important, but how to implicate AAP legislators is priority,” said AAP leader Sanjay Singh, lashing out at the police.

The police alleged that Mr. Yadav led a mob which vandalised public property and tried to burn vehicles. They also claimed that the politician and his men misbehaved with the police. After the arrest, Joint Commissioner of Police (South Western Range) Deependra Pathak said all necessary actions had been taken against the rape accused.

“While the accused was arrested by evening, much before the crowd gathered there, a rumour was floated that the police had refused to arrest him.”

The protesters on Thursday blocked traffic on the outskirts of Delhi claiming that the police had not provided a copy of the FIR to the victim’s family. Several persons were detained for rioting following the protests.
title: MLA’s arrest triggers police-AAP face-off
